alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Pickens; Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:20PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Tuscaloosa, northeastern Pickens, southwestern Fayette and southeastern Lamar Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 420 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Belk to 9 miles northwest of Samantha to near Bankhead Lock And Dam. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Millport, Kennedy, Belk, Ashcraft Corner, Bankhead Lock And Dam, Cody, Stone Wall, Wiley, Windham Springs, Hightogy and New Lexington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
